author: Adoxa
description: Continue playing Freelancer's audio when Alt-Tabbed. Offsets must be changed in both respective modules.

author: BC46
description: Disables the UI character typing text sounds completely.

author: Adoxa
description: Disables the typing effect for the arrival text.

author: Adoxa
description: Disables the typing effect for the target ship name and sub-target name text elements. All offsets must be changed.

author: Adoxa
description: Allow the `fc_n_grp` faction to drop `[phantom_loot]` loot.

author: foxUnit01
description: Initial NPC min spawn distance in SP and MP (such as after respawn).

author: Dev
description: Initial NPC max spawn distance in SP and MP.

author: Dev
description: NPC max spawn distance in SP and MP.

author: Gold_Sear
description: Allow NPC max spawn distance below 2500.

author: adoxa
description: SpacePop 'heartbeat' interval in seconds.

author: foxUnit01
description: Maximum distance that NPCs will persist in SP.

author: Dev
description: Maximum distance that NPCs will persist in MP.

author: Dev
description: Distance over which NPC spawning will ignore density cap in SP.

author: Dev
description: Distance over which NPC spawning will ignore density cap in MP (in other words, players within this distance to another will 'share spawns' and must move this distance away to start spawning 'own' NPCs).

author: Vital
description: Multiplier for patrol_path spawn distances, double this to double patrol_path spawn ranges, use in tandem with below (715 = 10k).

author: foxUnit01
description: patrol_path NPC min spawn distance check, patrol_path spawns below this distance will be rejected, use in tandem with above.

author: Vital
description: Distance from the edge of the zone NPCs begin to spawn.

author: Vital
description: Distance that patrol_path NPCs spawn when players are close to each other in patrol path (so far seems like closer than 300m).

author: Vital
description: Distance from a disrupted tradelane that tradelaneattackers are created.

author: Vital
description: Distance from the last tradelane ring that FL will generate NPCs from when you enter tradelane (note: same offset as zone edge NPC spawn distance).

author: Vital
description: Distance from the last tradelane ring that patrol_path NPCs created when you enter tradelane will still exist.

author: Vital
description: Distance from the last tradelane ring that patrol_path NPCs are created (2750 and more, no NPCs are created (unless patrol_path spawn distance is raised?)).

author: Vital
description: Distance from the tradelane ring (except the nearest one) at which NPCs with `arrival = tradelane` encounters are created (negative numbers accepted, though terminal ring will act up), there may be more 3750f in content.dll which may be relevant.

author: Vital
description: Minimum spawn distance for tradelane NPCs, tradelane spawns below this distance will be rejected and transferred to the next ring instead.

author: Dev
description: Max range at which NPCs will engage enemies, even if `attack_preference` under `jobblock` specify a higher range.

author: FriendlyFire
description: Maximum AI firing range.

author: adoxa
description: First value of Act_PlayerEnemyClamp. This determines how many NPCs will attack the player in SP (and also MP?).

author: adoxa
description: Second value of Act_PlayerEnemyClamp. This determines how many NPCs will attack the player in SP (and also MP?).

author: adoxa
description: Alternative to above: disable Act_PlayerEnemyClamp altogether, instead making NPC enemy target selection random.

author: adoxa
description: Remove FIGHTER/FREIGHTER testing on Player for `attack_preference` under `jobblock`.

author: adoxa
description: NPCs use scanner (enables CMs).

author: Dev
description: Max range at which NPCs will go hostile upon seeing their allies go hostile (both offsets must be changed).

author: Dev
description: Max range at which NPCs will scan your cargo.

author: Dev
description: Max range at which NPCs will initiate scan of your cargo.

author: M0tah, Gold_Sear
description: Min distance from player position at spawn moment that an NPC patrol with `arrival = cruise` will fly to when spawned.

author: M0tah, Gold_Sear
description: Max distance from player position at spawn moment that an NPC patrol with `arrival = cruise` will fly to when spawned.

author: Vital
description: Square of the distance from the end of the patrol_path to the object over which NPCs won't dock with it (so far only tested with jumpgates; increasing this may prevent PP crashes?).

author: Vital
description: unknown, increasing this to 1000f and more makes patrol_path NPCs stand still after spawn (side note by fox: this range seems to also denote the range which MsnRandEnc ships spawned with story scripting cut cruise and engage targets; if you're spawning ships with MsnRandEnc, try increasing this to make them more combat-effective).

author: adoxa
description: `nudge_force` sensitivity (higher = less auto-dodging from autopilot and AI).

author: foxUnit01
description: Autopilot helper value used by all AI functions, including NPC maneuvering and player autopilot; generally, set lower for a more accurate and picky autopilot (beware, has massive effect on how AI handle and may break your NPCs, so be very careful! - 1.34 is good).

author: foxUnit01
description: Default follow offset for following NPCs using FollowOp; a following NPC is to the right by default, but will appear on the left, below and above after jumping systems.

author: foxUnit01
description: Replace TrailOp behavior with FollowOp behavior.

author: adoxa
description: Replace TrailOp behavior with FollowOp behavior (addition to above, untested).

author: Gold_Sear
description: Make formation leader independent of escorts (this will make formation leaders able to flee).

author: Gold_Sear, M0tah
description: Distance ahead of formation leader escorts 'anticipate' to go to when catching up in cruise (decrease this to make escorts go in a straighter line towards the leader, but setting this too low causes them swing back and forth after a minor turn).

author: Gold_Sear
description: Distance from formation leader an escort will cruise to (before dropping out of cruise) when the leader is not cruising, as well as cruise catch up trail range.

author: M0tah
description: Increase this to enable large formations to dock with jumpgate; raise with caution however.

author: adoxa
description: Disable NPC firing timing delay.

author: adoxa
description: Adjusts CEGun::CanSeeTargetObject, allowing NPCs to 'see' everything (care: has a pretty significant impact on firing behavior).

author: adoxa
description: NPC muzzle cone angle (guns, radians).

author: Venemon
description: Autopilot will use thruster to catch up with formation.

author: Aingar
description: Force NPCs to use correct chasing behavior for shiptypes other than FIGHTER and FREIGHTER.

author: Adoxa
description: Drop cargo dialog timeout. Both options must be changed.

author: Adoxa
description: Time given to drop cargo by NPCs

author: Adoxa
description: Show cargo space using decimals. String 1179 in resources.dll must have %d changed to %g or %.2f. Both offsets must be changed.

description: Square of distance from loot that the 'tractor all' button appears on the HUD.

author: Fox
description: Multiplier for width of tractor beams.

description: Maximum distance to initiate trade.

description: Auto-level off by default. All offsets much be changed.

description: Disable level camera toggling.

author: adoxa
description: Maximum credits that a player can have in multiplayer. All offsets must be changed.

description: Maximum number of items in stock.

description: Items with 'ids_name = 0' show up in repair list.

description: Never show the EULA when launching the game by bypassing the registry key check. Alternatively, apply the patch directly to the root EBUEula.dll file.

description: Never load EBUEula.dll from the root Freelancer folder.

author: BC46
description: When a wreck gets shot, do not test if it has already been looted during a previous session. This allows looted wrecks to be looted another time after loading a saved game. NOTE: This patch only works in Single Player!

author: BC46
description: String ID for the Microsoft legal notice, which fills the <legal notice goes here> placeholder in the Server Configuration window. Change this value to another string ID in serverresources.dll to display different text.
